intro: Baeothryon hystrix, commonly known as the hairy baneberry, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It belongs to the family Berberidaceae and is characterized by its striking, spiny, red berries that appear in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and has dark green, compound leaves with a hairy texture. Its flowers are small and greenish-white, clustered in umbels, and it is known for its toxicity to both humans and animals. The hairy baneberry is also notable for its historical use in traditional medicine and its role in local ecosystems.
